result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Johnny Lee Rogers Jr

defendant.name: Rogers, Johnny Lee, Jr
defendant.address: 4032 West Green Tree Road, Milwaukee, WI 53209

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Johnny Lee Rogers Jr not in court, in custody.  Attorney Brett Lee Copeland appeared by video for Johnny Lee Rogers Jr.  Defendant's appearance waived.  Attorney Patrick T Franken for Jon R Josephsen Jr. in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for scheduling conference. Defense filed motion to suppress custodial statements and requested motion hearing date. Court ordered case adjourned for motion hearing in room 310 of the Safety Building with Judge Franke. Court scheduled deadline for State to file motion response by 11-14-2022. Motion hearing scheduled for November 21, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

Defendant Johnny Lee Rogers Jr not in court, in custody.  Attorney Brett Lee Copeland appeared by video for Johnny Lee Rogers Jr.  Attorney Jon R Josephsen Jr. in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Case in court for a status conference.  Defense filed Notice of Motion and Motion to Suppress Statements.  Court informs parties of calendar congestion and suggests this matter to be heard in front of Reserve Judge Franke.  Court scheduled a status conference to allow Defense counsel time to speak with client.  Case adjourned to Branch 16, Rm 503 CH.
Status conference scheduled for October 21, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant's Notice of Motion and Motion to Suppress Custodial Statements.  Received and Filed. n,

Defendant Johnny Lee Rogers Jr not in court, in custody.  Attorney Brett Lee Copeland appeared by video for Johnny Lee Rogers Jr.  Attorney Jon R Josephsen Jr. in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for Scheduling Conference. Defendant not produced. Defense counsel informs court that they received discovery materials, but are still awaiting an offer from the State. Defense further requests a status conference date. Case adjourned to Br 16.
Status conference scheduled for October 10, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Johnny Lee Rogers in court with Attorney Brett Lee Copeland; both appear by video.  Defendant Johnny Lee Rogers in custody.  Abby Rockendorf appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Court took judicial notice of 17CF1469. Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: Officer D. Krenzien. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 16.  Scheduling conference scheduled for September 19, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Brett Lee Copeland in court by video, defendant Johnny Lee Rogers not in court, in custody.  Abby Rockendorf appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness is present. Mr Rogers was not scheduled to appear with MSDF for todays proceedings. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 11, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
Received and Filed. Public Defender Order Appointing Counsel

Defendant Johnny Lee Rogers in court, in custody at MSDF.  Adam Joseph Best appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case set for Preliminary hearing. State Public Defenders Office needs more time to appoint counsel. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 15, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 3.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.  Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription.

Defendant Johnny Lee Rogers in court with attorney Amanda M. Parent.  Defendant Johnny Lee Rogers in custody.  Joshua Milder appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Johnny Lee Rogers appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Grayson, Branch 16.  AS TO COUNT 1 " second and subsequent offense enhancer":  Motion to dismiss by the defense for lack of probable cause, argued and GRANTED by the Court.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 21, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
Case tabbed to Br 21 in error
